summary: This document appears to be an internal email chain from July 24, 2019, discussing a psychologist's reluctance to complete a disciplinary or competency report for an inmate, referencing an incident report and concerns about testifying. The context strongly suggests the inmate is Jeffrey Epstein, as he is directly named, and the discussion involves his reported suicidality and competency while in Special Watch (SW) status.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the inmate for whom a psychologist is avoiding writing a disciplinary/competency report, with mention of an incident report and reported suicidality while on Special Watch (SW).

events.title: Email discussion about Epstein's competency report
events.description: Internal email chain discussing a psychologist's refusal to complete a disciplinary or competency report for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, citing fears of being torn up on the stand and losing her license if called to testify.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated July 24, 2019, discussing clinical responsibilities regarding an inmate.
The inmate is directly named as Epstein, and the context involves his reported suicidality and an incident report while on Special Watch (SW).
A psychologist is described as avoiding writing a disciplinary/competency report for Epstein, fearing she would 'get torn up on the stand and lose her license' if called to testify.
The discussion criticizes the psychologist's inefficiency and avoidance of her job, describing it as 'poor leadership'.
The emails suggest a process where a disciplinary report is needed because Epstein received an incident report while on SW or went to SW right after an incident.
